title: CGAL Build Broken by New Dependencies
body:
@adamjstewart 
Recent changes to CGAL (2015-09-22) added a bunch of new REQUIRED dependencies that are not in fact required.  I know the docs are fuzzy on this issue; but see section "7 CGAL Libraries" here:  http://doc.cgal.org/latest/Manual/installation.html

Yes, Qt5 is required if you want to run demos.  OpenGL is required if you want to read/write images.  But only GMP and MPFR are required to build core CGAL.

In general... extra dependencies beyond what is required for a library's core functionality should almost always be added as Spack variants.  If people are already using a package successfully, and the package is not mistakenly linking to system libraries, then you can assume that dependencies not listed are not required for core functionality.

I believe this needs to be sorted out for CGAL.  Until then I'm reverting back to the pre-Sep 22 version for my own use.  I cannot afford to build the world, I don't have enough inodes for that.
